On Thu, May 01, 2003 at 04:33:06AM -0000, softtouchit wrote:
> Dear All,
> 
> Everyone is taking the document centric approach, even for the SOAP
> guys. This appears to be a good step away from "fine grained" RPC.
> Some new additions to SOAP 1.2 look like RESTful.
> 
> Questions are:
> 
> 1. Is the new SOAP (1.2) RESTful enough that one can build a REST Web
> Services?

Yes.  SOAP 1.1 was too, though.

> 2. Has anyone actually implemeted a RESTful Web Services? 

KnowNow had some demo apps that I saw that were.
And see http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-ws-arch/2002Jul/0301.html

There was one other one, but I can't find it.  Sad, really.

MB
